item.text: When these things had been accomplished and the rage of King Ahasuerus had diminished, he remembered Vashti and what she had done and what had been decided against her.

The <st data-num="04428" class="">king’s</st> <st data-num="05288" class="">servants</st> who <st data-num="08334" class="">attended</st> him <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st>, “Let a <st data-num="01245" class="">search</st> be conducted on the <st data-num="04428" class="">king’s</st> behalf for <st data-num="02896 04758">attractive</st> <st data-num="05291" class="">young</st> <st data-num="01330" class="">women</st>.<n id="1" />

And let the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> <st data-num="06485" class="">appoint</st> <st data-num="06496" class="">officers</st> throughout <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> the <st data-num="04082" class="">provinces</st> of his <st data-num="04438" class="">kingdom</st> to <st data-num="06908" class="">gather</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> the <st data-num="02896 04758">attractive</st> <st data-num="05291" class="">young</st> <st data-num="01330" class="">women</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> <st data-num="07800" class="">Susa</st> the <st data-num="01002" class="">citadel</st>, <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> the <st data-num="01004 0802">harem</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="0413" class="">under</st> the <st data-num="03027" class="">authority</st> of <st data-num="01896" class="">Hegai</st>, the <st data-num="04428" class="">king’s</st> <st data-num="05631" class="">eunuch</st> who <st data-num="08104" class="">oversees</st> the <st data-num="0802" class="">women</st>, and let him <st data-num="05414" class="">provide</st> whatever <st data-num="08562" class="">cosmetics</st> they desire.<n id="2" />
Let the young woman whom the king finds most attractive become queen in place of Vashti.” This seemed like a good idea to the king, so he acted accordingly.
Now there happened to be a Jewish man in Susa the citadel whose name was Mordecai. He was the son of Jair, the son of Shimei, the son of Kish, a Benjaminite,

<st data-num="0834" class="">who</st> had been <st data-num="01540" class="">taken into exile</st> from <st data-num="03389" class="">Jerusalem</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="05973" class="">with</st> the <st data-num="01473" class="">captives</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">who</st> had been <st data-num="01540" class="">carried into exile</st> <st data-num="05973" class="">with</st> <st data-num="03204" class="">Jeconiah</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> of <st data-num="03063" class="">Judah</st>, <st data-num="0834" class="">whom</st> <st data-num="05019" class="">Nebuchadnezzar</st> <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> of <st data-num="0894" class="">Babylon</st> had <st data-num="01540" class="">taken into exile</st>.

Now he was acting as the guardian of Hadassah (that is, Esther), the daughter of his uncle, for neither her father nor her mother was alive. This young woman was very attractive and had a beautiful figure. When her father and mother died, Mordecai had raised her as if she were his own daughter.

It so happened that when the king’s edict and his law became known many young women were taken to Susa the citadel to be placed under the authority of Hegai. Esther also was taken to the royal palace to be under the authority of Hegai, who was overseeing the women.

This young woman pleased him, and she found favor with him. He quickly provided her with her cosmetics and her rations; he also provided her with the seven specially chosen young women who were from the palace. He then transferred her and her young women to the best quarters in the harem.
Now Esther had not disclosed her people or her lineage, for Mordecai had instructed her not to do so.
And day after day Mordecai used to walk back and forth in front of the court of the harem in order to learn how Esther was doing and what might happen to her.

At the end of the twelve months that were required for the women, when the turn of each young woman arrived to go to King Ahasuerus—for in this way they had to fulfill their time of cosmetic treatment: six months with oil of myrrh, and six months with perfume and various ointments used by women—

the <st data-num="05291" class="">woman</st> would <st data-num="0935" class="">go</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> in the <st data-num="02088" class="">following way</st>: <st data-num="03605 0834">Whatever</st> she <st data-num="0559" class="">asked for</st> would be <st data-num="05414" class="">provided</st> for her to <st data-num="0935" class="">take</st> <st data-num="05973" class="">with</st> her from the <st data-num="01004 0802">harem</st> <st data-num="05704" class="">to</st> the <st data-num="04428" class="">royal</st> <st data-num="01004" class="">palace</st>.

In the evening she went, and in the morning she returned to a separate part of the harem, to the authority of Shaashgaz, the king’s eunuch who was overseeing the concubines. She would not go back to the king unless the king was pleased with her and she was requested by name.

When it became the turn of Esther, daughter of Abihail, the uncle of Mordecai (who had raised her as if she were his own daughter), to go to the king, she did not request anything except what Hegai the king’s eunuch, who was overseer of the women, had recommended. Yet Esther met with the approval of all who saw her.

Then <st data-num="0635" class="">Esther</st> was <st data-num="03947" class="">taken</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> <st data-num="04428" class="">King</st> <st data-num="0325" class="">Ahasuerus</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">at</st> his <st data-num="04438" class="">royal</st> <st data-num="01004" class="">residence</st> in the <st data-num="06224" class="">tenth</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="02320" class="">month</st> (<st data-num="01931" class="">that</st> is, the <st data-num="02320" class="">month</st> of <st data-num="02887" class="">Tebeth)</st> in the <st data-num="07651" class="">seventh</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="08141" class="">year</st> of his <st data-num="04438" class="">reign</st>.

And the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> <st data-num="0157" class="">loved</st> <st data-num="0635" class="">Esther</st> more than <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> the other <st data-num="0802" class="">women</st>, and she <st data-num="05375" class="">met</st> <st data-num="06440" class="">with</st> his <st data-num="02617" class="">loving</st> <st data-num="02580" class="">approval</st><n id="1" /> more than <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> the other <st data-num="01330" class="">young women</st>.<n id="2" /> So he <st data-num="07760" class="">placed</st> the <st data-num="04438" class="">royal</st> <st data-num="03804" class="">high turban</st> on her <st data-num="07218" class="">head</st> and <st data-num="04427" class="">appointed</st> her <st data-num="04427" class="">queen</st><n id="3" /> <st data-num="08478" class="">in place of</st> <st data-num="02060" class="">Vashti</st>.

Then the king prepared a large banquet for all his officials and his servants—it was actually Esther’s banquet. He also set aside a holiday for the provinces, and he provided for offerings at the king’s expense.
Now when the young women were being gathered again, Mordecai was sitting at the king’s gate.
Esther was still not divulging her lineage or her people, just as Mordecai had instructed her. Esther continued to do whatever Mordecai said, just as she had done when he was raising her.
In those days while Mordecai was sitting at the king’s gate, Bigthan and Teresh, two of the king’s eunuchs who protected the entrance, became angry and plotted to assassinate King Ahasuerus.

When <st data-num="04782" class="">Mordecai</st> <st data-num="03045" class="">learned</st> of the <st data-num="01697" class="">conspiracy</st>,<n id="1" /> he <st data-num="05046" class="">informed</st> <st data-num="04436" class="">Queen</st> <st data-num="0635" class="">Esther</st>,<n id="2" /> and <st data-num="0635" class="">Esther</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">told</st> the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> in <st data-num="04782" class="">Mordecai’s</st> <st data-num="08034" class="">name</st>.
The king then had the matter investigated and, finding it to be so, had the two conspirators hanged on a gallows. It was then recorded in the daily chronicles in the king’s presence.
